Function Documentation

void icmDisableTraceBuffer ( icmProcessorP  processor  ) 

Disable trace buffer for the passed processor.

Parameters:
processor Turn off trace buffer for this processor.
void icmDumpTraceBuffer ( icmProcessorP  processor  ) 

Dump the processor trace buffer.

Parameters:
processor The processor of interest.
void icmEnableTraceBuffer ( icmProcessorP  processor  ) 

Enable trace buffer for the passed processor The trace buffer records the last few addresses the processor executed, so that when a problem occurs, a short instruction history can be recovered.

Parameters:
processor Turn on trace buffer for this processor.
void icmTraceOffAfter ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Uns64  iDelta 
)

Disable tracing for the processor after 'iDelta' more instructions.

Parameters:
processor Turn off tracing for this processor.
iDelta Number of instructions before tracing is turned off.
void icmTraceOnAfter ( icmProcessorP  processor,
Uns64  iDelta 
)

Enable tracing for the processor after 'iDelta' more instructions Tracing causes a single line of text to be output (including a disassembly of the current instruction). Note that global simulation attributes control the amount of extra detail that are added to the trace. This can include converting addresses to labels by looking in the object file, or giving a complete register dump after each instruction.

Parameters:
processor Turn on tracing for this processor.
iDelta Number of instructions before tracing is turned on.
